etymology.description: 氏(氏) (shì, "clan; bowing figure") + 一 (line) -> bowing figure depicted with a mark at the bottom -> root of a tree
etymology.interpretation: The character 氐(dǐ) visually combines the concepts of a bowing figure with a mark at the bottom, which suggests an origin or a base, much like the roots of a tree reaching into the ground. This pictorial representation provides a visual metaphor for the foundational meaning of the character.

examples.chinese: 古人用氐记音(古人用氐記音)，只是作辅助作用(只是作輔助作用)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔ rén yòng dǐ jì yīn, zhǐ shì zuò fǔ zhù zuò yòng.
examples.english: Ancient people used dǐ for phonetic notation, merely serving an auxiliary function.

examples.chinese: 在某些书法中(在某些書法中)，氐被用作音标(氐被用作音標)。
examples.pinyin: Zài mǒuxiē shūfǎ zhōng, dǐ bèi yòng zuò yīnbiāo.
examples.english: In some calligraphy, dǐ is used as a phonetic marker.
